summary: Email from defense attorney Michael Miller to prosecutor Reid Weingarten regarding logistics for delivering a hard drive containing discovery materials and confirming compliance with a protective order in the Jeffrey Epstein case. Shows coordination between defense and prosecution teams.

persons.name: Michael C. Miller
persons.context: Partner at Steptoe & Johnson LLP, representing Jeffrey Epstein's defense team, coordinating delivery of discovery materials and compliance with protective order.

persons.name: Reid Weingarten
persons.context: Recipient of the email, appears to be a prosecutor involved in the Epstein case, coordinating with defense counsel on discovery matters.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The defendant in the case, referenced indirectly as 'Epstein' in the subject line and as the subject of the defense team's work.

connections.description: Miller is a defense attorney representing Epstein, coordinating discovery compliance on his behalf.
Defense attorney and prosecutor communicating about case logistics and discovery compliance.

events.title: Court appearance scheduled
events.description: Planned court appearance where Miller will deliver a hard drive with discovery materials and confirm compliance with protective order.

locations: 1114 Avenue of the Americas, New York, NY (Steptoe & Johnson LLP office)
keyFacts: Defense attorney Michael Miller confirms Epstein's defense team will be in compliance with a protective order by the court date.
Miller plans to hand-deliver a hard drive containing the first round of production (discovery materials) to prosecutor Reid Weingarten.
The email shows ongoing legal proceedings and discovery exchanges in the Epstein case in August 2019.
Communication demonstrates professional coordination between defense and prosecution teams regarding logistical and compliance matters.
